dialogue_turns.speaker: Host
dialogue_turns.text: Back in 2019, Amazon Web Services just lost that massive $10 billion Pentagon cloud contract to Microsoft.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Back in twenty nineteen, Amazon Web Services just lost that massive ten dollars billion Pentagon cloud contract to Microsoft.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: AWS, the e-commerce giants cloud computing division, lost its bid to provide the military with cloud infrastructure to Microsoft in October. Amazon claims it lost the $10 billion contract because Trump is personally biased against CEO Jeff Bezos for his ownership of the Washington Post, which Trump claims publishes unfair and negative coverage about him.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and now they're really turning up the heat. They're calling for depositions from President Trump and Defense Secretary Mark Esper.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and now they're really turning up the heat. They're calling for depositions from President Trump and Defense Secretary Mark Esper.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amazon on Monday escalated its fierce opposition to Microsoft winning a lucrative government contract by calling for testimony from the president and Defense Secretary Mark Esper, according to court documents. In a filing with the U.S. Court of Federal Claims, Amazon Web Services asked a judge to allow depositions from Trump, Esper, former Defense Secretary Jim Mattis and Defense Department Chief Information Officer Dana Deasy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they want testimony, uh, from a bunch of key figures—former Defense Secretary Jim Morrison, too, and Dana Deasy from the DoD.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they want testimony, uh, from a bunch of key figures-former Defense Secretary Jim Morrison, too, and Dana Deasy from the DoD.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a filing with the U.S. Court of Federal Claims, Amazon Web Services asked a judge to allow depositions from Trump, Esper, former Defense Secretary Jim Mattis and Defense Department Chief Information Officer Dana Deasy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And it's not just about the testimony, they're asking for court-ordered discovery. They want all the documents, emails, anything related to how this contract was made.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's not just about the testimony, they're asking for court-ordered discovery. They want all the documents, emails, anything related to how this contract was made.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amazon is also asking for court-ordered discovery, meaning the company wants the Trump administration to hand over documents and emails relating to the contract.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Their argument is pretty bold—they're saying Trump is biased against Jeff Bezos because of the Washington Post.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Their argument is pretty bold-they're saying Trump is biased against Jeff Bezos because of the Washington Post.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amazon claims it lost the $10 billion contract because Trump is personally biased against CEO Jeff Bezos for his ownership of the Washington Post, which Trump claims publishes unfair and negative coverage about him.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, they even cited tweets where Trump called him "Jeff Bozo." That's pretty direct.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, they even cited tweets where Trump called him Jeff Bozo. That's pretty direct.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The filing cites Trumps tweets attacking Bezos, including one calling him Jeff Bozo, and a passage from an October 2019 book by Mattiss speechwriter, who wrote that Trump said he wanted to screw Amazon out of the contract, as evidence of the presidents intent and hostility toward Amazon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And there's that passage from Mattis's speechwriter's book where Trump allegedly wanted to, quote, "screw Amazon" out of the deal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And there's that passage from Mattis's speechwriter's book where Trump allegedly wanted to, quote, screw Amazon out of the deal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The filing cites Trumps tweets attacking Bezos, including one calling him Jeff Bozo, and a passage from an October 2019 book by Mattiss speechwriter, who wrote that Trump said he wanted to screw Amazon out of the contract, as evidence of the presidents intent and hostility toward Amazon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So they're building a case that this wasn't about merit at all—it was personal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So they're building a case that this wasn't about merit at all-it was personal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And this isn't the first time there's been controversy around this contract. Remember IBM and Oracle filed complaints earlier?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And this isn't the first time there's been controversy around this contract. Remember I B M and Oracle filed complaints earlier?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: IBM and Oracle filed complaints with the Government Accountability Office alleging the Pentagon was biased toward Amazon (both claims were eventually dismissed).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they claimed the Pentagon was biased toward Amazon, but those got dismissed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they claimed the Pentagon was biased toward Amazon, but those got dismissed.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: IBM and Oracle filed complaints with the Government Accountability Office alleging the Pentagon was biased toward Amazon (both claims were eventually dismissed).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then Trump said he'd scrutinize the bidding process himself, which definitely raised some eyebrows.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then Trump said he'd scrutinize the bidding process himself, which definitely raised some eyebrows.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Responding to those complaints, Trump at one point said he would look into the bidding process, stoking fears from lawmakers that the contract might be delayed.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: An AWS spokesperson called it out—saying Trump uses his position to interfere with government functions for his personal agenda.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: An A W S spokesperson called it out-saying Trump uses his position to interfere with government functions for his personal agenda.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President Trump has repeatedly demonstrated his willingness to use his position as President and Commander in Chief to interfere with government functionsincluding federal procurementsto advance his personal agenda, an AWS spokesperson said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's a huge escalation, taking it right to the court like this. I mean, calling for a sitting president to testify?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a huge escalation, taking it right to the court like this. I mean, calling for a sitting president to testify?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that doesn't happen every day. This could get really messy, really fast.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that doesn't happen every day. This could get really messy, really fast.

artist_script:
Back in 2019, Amazon Web Services just lost that massive $10 billion Pentagon cloud contract to Microsoft.
HostB: Right, and now they're really turning up the heat. They’re calling for depositions from President Trump and Defense Secretary Mark Esper.
HostA: Yeah, they want testimony, uh, from a bunch of key figures—former Defense Secretary Jim Morrison, too, and Dana Deasy from the DoD.
HostB: And it's not just about the testimony, they're asking for court-ordered discovery. They want all the documents, emails, anything related to how this contract was made.
HostA: Their argument is pretty bold—they’re saying Trump is biased against Jeff Bezos because of the Washington Post.
HostB: Oh yeah, they even cited tweets where Trump called him "Jeff Bozo." That's pretty direct.
HostA: And there’s that passage from Mattis’s speechwriter’s book where Trump allegedly wanted to, quote, "screw Amazon" out of the deal.
HostB: So they’re building a case that this wasn't about merit at all—it was personal.
HostA: Exactly. And this isn't the first time there's been controversy around this contract. Remember IBM and Oracle filed complaints earlier?
HostB: Yeah, they claimed the Pentagon was biased toward Amazon, but those got dismissed.
HostA: And then Trump said he'd scrutinize the bidding process himself, which definitely raised some eyebrows.
HostB: An AWS spokesperson called it out—saying Trump uses his position to interfere with government functions for his personal agenda.
HostA: It’s a huge escalation, taking it right to the court like this. I mean, calling for a sitting president to testify?
HostB: Yeah, that doesn't happen every day. This could get really messy, really fast.
